name: Bethmaennchen (German Marzipan Christmas Cookies)
author: nch
summary: Bethmännchen are a marzipan specialty from Frankfurt, Germany. It translates to "little praying men". They can easily be made at home, It's important to only use very neatly halved almonds for good-looking Bethmännchen.
directions: Preheat the oven to 200 degrees F (95 degrees C)
Line a baking sheet with parchment paper
Knead marzipan well and divide into about forty 1 1/2-inch cubes of equal size
Roll each cube into a ball and shape into a round cylinder with a point
Push 3 halved almonds into each marzipan cylinder so the pointy sides of the almonds are facing the top
Beat egg white lightly in a cup and brush each cookie with egg white
Set onto the prepared baking sheet
Bake in the preheated until the tops of the almonds are lightly browned, about 15 minutes
